title: Woman fatally shot in Hazelwood is identified
content:
HAZELWOOD • Authorities on Wednesday identified a woman fatally shot here over the weekend as Emma Wallace, 37, of Centralia, Ill.
Wallace was riding in the front passenger seat of a Jeep about 2 a.m. Sunday when shots were fired from a stolen Mercedes-Benz that pulled alongside, on Interstate 270 near North Lindbergh Boulevard.
The Mercedes was recovered shortly after the shooting, abandoned on Target Drive off of New Halls Ferry Road in north St. Louis County. Police said it had been taken in a carjacking at a Sauget gas station about 10:30 p.m. Saturday.
The three others in the Jeep, two men and a woman, were wounded. The male driver took them to Barnes-Jewish Hospital in St. Louis.
The Major Case Squad is investigating. Police said they believe the victims, friends in their 20s and 30s, had just left Jay's Classic Bar & Grill, 7217 North Lindbergh Boulevard. Detectives were investigating whether the shooting stemmed from something that happened there.
